timeline.bodyText:
Any reason why the iteration needs to be backwards?
Otherwise may be replaced by tasks.forEach(...).
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
The chained graph structure constructed by optaplanner in this case is like this
User <-> T1 <-> T2 <-> T3 <-> T4
and when the tasks for a particular user are being released it's better to process the graph in reverse order.
i.e. release T4, release T3... and so on.
by doing this we have to do less movements in the structure, but also note that at some invocations I'm only interested on releasing the non-pinned tasks. And again, in the constructed graph (by definition) the pinned tasks must always be at the head of the graph.
in the example above we could have T1 pinned and T2 pinned. So again, at time of releasing the User non pinned tasks it's better to process the structure in reverse order.
